intro: Chaetocarpus africanus, commonly known as the African bristly sida, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in savanna and grassland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
